info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 11:57AM EDT until June 22 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Binghamton NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Continued flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Broome and Delaware.
* WHEN...Until 145 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain from thunderstorms that occurred this morning. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell this morning. Residual flooding remains across several locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walton, Deposit, Sidney, Sanford, Colchester, Unadilla, Hancock, Franklin, Sidney Center, East Sidney, Harvard, Fishs Eddy, East Branch, Harpursville, Masonville, Trout Creek, Loomis, Cannonsville, Rock Rift and Beerston. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
